translation: Seeing that she was very attractive and pleasing, he asked the brahmin to ask for her.

source_sentence: 梵志即與王，王即立為第二夫人。
translation: The priest then gave her to the king, who established her as the second wife.

source_sentence: 「此女少小仙人養育，受性端直，不解婦女妖[卄\/(阿-可+辛)\/女]之事。
translation: “This woman was raised by a young sage, who was straight and upright by nature and didn’t understand the affairs of women [(a-ka+sin)\/women].

source_sentence: 後時有娠，相師占言：『當生千子。』
translation: Later, there was a pregnant woman who said to the soothsayer, 'A thousand sons will be born.'

source_sentence: 王大夫人，聞此語已，心生妬忌，漸作計校，恩厚招喻鹿女夫人左右侍從，
translation: The king’s queen, hearing these words, became jealous and gradually calculated. Her kindness was like inviting a woman named Deer Woman to accompany her.

source_sentence: 饒與錢財珍寶。
translation: He gave him money, possessions, and treasures.

source_sentence: 爾時鹿女，日月滿足，便生千葉蓮華。
translation: It was then that the deer woman, when the sun and moon were full, produced a thousand leaves of lotus flowers.

source_sentence: 欲生之時，大夫人以物瞞眼，不聽自看，捉臭爛馬肺，承著其下，取千葉蓮華，
translation: When she was about to be born, the great queen hid her eyes with something and didn't listen to herself. She grabbed the smelly horse's lungs, put them under it, and took a thousand-petaled lotus flower.

source_sentence: 盛著檻裏，擲於河中，還為解眼而語之言：『看汝所生，唯見一段臭爛馬肺。』
translation: Putting it inside the threshold, he tossed it into the river and returned to untie his eyes and said, 'Look at what you've produced, seeing only one piece of a foul-smelling horse lung.'

source_sentence: 王遣人問：『為生何物？』
translation: The king sent someone to ask, 'What's the thing that's produced?'

source_sentence: 而答王言：『唯生臭爛馬肺之物。』
translation: He answered the king, saying, 'Only the smelly and rotten horse's lungs give rise to things.'

source_sentence: 時大夫人而語王言：『王喜到惑，此畜生所生，仙人所養，生此不祥臭穢之物。』
translation: The great lady then said to the king, 'The king is delighted with the afflictions, saying, 'This animal born from animals and nurtured by sages gives rise to this inauspicious and smelly thing.'

source_sentence: 王大夫人，即便退其夫人之職，不復聽見。
translation: The king's great wife then withdrew from her post and no longer listened to him.

source_sentence: 「時烏耆延王，將諸徒從夫人婇女，下流遊戲。
translation: At the time, King Ughiyan led his disciples downstream to play with their wives and court ladies.

source_sentence: 見黃雲蓋，從河上流，隨水而來，王作是念：『此雲蓋下，必有神物。』
translation: Seeing the yellow cloud cover that flowed up from the river and came along with the water, the king thought, 'There must be a divine object beneath this cloud cover.'

source_sentence: 遣人往看，於黃雲下，見有一檻，即便接取，開而看之，見千葉蓮華，
translation: He sent men to see it. Below the yellow clouds he saw a threshold, which was then opened and looked like a thousand petals of lotus blossoms.

source_sentence: 一葉有一小兒，取之養育，以漸長大，各皆有大力士之力。
translation: Each leaf had a small child who took it and raised it, each gradually growing into an adult with the power of a great man.

source_sentence: 「烏耆延王，歲常貢獻梵豫王，集諸獻物，遣使欲去。
translation: When the king of Udyāna always contributed to the monastery every year, King Brahmadatta gathered all the offerings and sent an envoy to depart.

source_sentence: 諸子問言：『欲作何等？』
translation: The children asked, 'What do you want to do?'

source_sentence: 時王答言：『欲貢獻彼梵豫國王。』
translation: The king then answered, 'I want to contribute to that king of Brahmā.'

source_sentence: 諸子各言：『若有一子，猶望能伏天下使來貢獻，況有我等千子，而當獻他？』
translation: Each of the children said, 'If there's a single child, how could he still hope to subdue the world and send an envoy to contribute? How could there be a thousand sons like us who would offer them up to him?'

source_sentence: 千子即時將諸軍眾，降伏諸國，次第來到梵豫王國。
translation: The thousand sons immediately gathered their armies to subdue the kingdoms and came one after another to the kingdom of Brahmadeva.

source_sentence: 王聞軍至，募其國中：『誰能攘却如此之敵？』
translation: When the king heard that an army was arriving, he gathered his country and asked, 'Who will be able to drive out such an enemy?'

source_sentence: 都無有人能攘却者。
translation: There's no one who can refute it.

source_sentence: 第二夫人，來受募言：『我能却之。』
translation: The second wife came to accept the invitation, saying, 'I can remove it.'

source_sentence: 問言：『云何得攘却之？』
translation: He asked, 'How can you get rid of it?'

source_sentence: 夫人答言：『但為我作百丈之臺，我坐其上，必能攘却。』
translation: The lady replied, 'Just make a hundred-foot platform for me, and if I sit on it, I'll surely be able to get rid of it.'

source_sentence: 作臺已竟，第二夫人，在上而坐。
translation: After the terrace had been built, the second wife sat on top of it.

source_sentence: 爾時千子，欲舉弓射，自然手不能舉。
translation: At the time, a thousand children wanted to raise their bow and shoot, but they naturally couldn't lift it with their hands.

source_sentence: 夫人語言：『汝慎莫舉手向於父母，我是汝母。』
translation: The lady said, 'Don't raise your hand to your parents; I am your mother.'

source_sentence: 千子問言：『何以為驗得知我母？』
translation: The thousand sons asked, 'What's the way to testify to knowing my mother?'

source_sentence: 答言：『我若按乳，一乳有五百岐，各入汝口，是汝之母；
translation: They replied, “If I pressed the milk into your mouth and each of my five hundred breasts entered it, she would be your mother.

source_sentence: 若當不爾，非是汝母。』
translation: If that's not the case, it's not your mother.'

source_sentence: 即時兩手按乳，一乳之中，有五百岐，入千子口中，其餘軍眾，無有得者。
translation: Immediately, he pressed his two hands onto the milk, and within a single drop of milk there were five hundred branches that entered into the mouths of a thousand sons, but none of the other soldiers could get it.

source_sentence: 千子降伏，向父母懺悔。
translation: The thousand sons were subdued and repented to their parents.

source_sentence: 諸子於是和合，二國無復怨讎，自相勸率，以五百子與親父母，以五百子與養父母。
translation: The children were then reconciled, and the two kingdoms no longer had any grudge against each other. They encouraged each other to give five hundred children to their parents and five hundred children to their nurturing parents.

source_sentence: 時二國王，分閻浮提，各畜五百子。」
translation: The two kings then divided Jambudvīpa into five hundred sons each.

source_sentence: 佛言：「欲知彼時千子者，賢劫千佛是也。
translation: The Buddha said, You want to know that the thousand sons at that time were the thousand buddhas of the good eon.

source_sentence: 爾時嫉妬夫人瞞他目者，交鱗瞽目龍是。
translation: At the time, the jealous woman who secreted her eyes to others was the eye dragon with a pair of scales and black eyes.

source_sentence: 爾時父者，白淨王是。
translation: At the time, the father was King Śubhavyūha.

source_sentence: 爾時母者，摩耶夫人是。」
translation: The mother at the time was Mrs. Māyā.

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛言：「此女有何因緣，生鹿腹中，足下生蓮華？
translation: The monks asked the Buddha, What's the reason this woman was born in the belly of a deer and gave rise to lotus flowers under her feet?

source_sentence: 復有何因緣，為王夫人？」
translation: Again, what is the reason for being the king's wife?

source_sentence: 佛言：「此女過去世時，生貧賤家。
translation: The Buddha said, In a past life, this woman was born in a poor family.

source_sentence: 母子二人，田中鋤穀，見一辟支佛，持鉢乞食，母語女言：『我欲家中取我食分與是快士。』
translation: When both mothers and sons saw a pratyekabuddha in the field of sowing grain and saw a pratyekabuddha carrying an almsbowl to beg for food, his mother said to her daughter, 'I want to take my portion of food

source_sentence: 女言：『亦取我分并與。』
translation: The woman said, 'Also take my share and give it to him.'

source_sentence: 母即歸家，取母子二人食分，來與辟支佛。
translation: The mother then returned home, took the two portions of food for her mother and children, and gave them to the pratyekabuddha.

source_sentence: 女取草採華，為之敷草坐，散華著上，請辟支佛坐。
translation: The woman grasped the grass and gathered flowers for him. She spread out a piece of grass for him to sit on, scattered flowers over him, and invited the pratyekabuddha to take his seat.

source_sentence: 女怪母遲，上一高處，遙望其母，已見其母，而語母言：『何不急疾？
translation: Surprised by her mother's delay, the daughter went up into a high place and looked at her from a distance. Seeing her mother, she said to her mother, 'Why don't you go quickly?'

source_sentence: 鹿驟而來。』
translation: The deer rushed and came.'

source_sentence: 母既至已，嫌母遲故，尋作恨言：『我生在母邊，不如鹿邊生也。』
translation: When his mother arrived, she resented her lateness and became angry, saying, 'I'm born near my mother; it's not like being born near a deer.'

source_sentence: 母即以二分食與辟支佛，餘殘母子共食。
translation: The mother then gave two parts of the food to the pratyekabuddha and shared it with the other remaining mothers and children.

source_sentence: 辟支佛食訖，擲鉢著虛空中，尋逐飛去，到虛空中，作十八變。
translation: After he had finished his meal, the pratyekabuddha tossed his bowl into the sky and flew away in search of it. Having arrived in the sky, he made eighteen transformations.

source_sentence: 時母歡喜，即發誓願：『使我將來恒生聖子，如今聖人。』
translation: Rejoicing, the mother then made a vow, 'May I always give birth to a noble child in the future, who's now a sage.'

source_sentence: 以是業緣，後生五百子，皆得辟支佛，一作養母，一作所生母。
translation: Because of these karmic conditions, five hundred sons were born later, all of whom became pratyekabuddhas, one being the nurturing mother and one being the mother who gave birth to them.

source_sentence: 以語母鹿驟對言因緣，生鹿腹中，脚似鹿甲。
translation: He told his mother the reason and was born in the womb of the deer, with legs resembling those of a deer’s armor.

source_sentence: 以採華散辟支佛故，跡中一百華生。
translation: Because they gathered flowers and scattered them to the pratyekabuddhas, a hundred flowers were produced in their traces.

source_sentence: 以敷草故，常得為王夫人。
translation: Because they spread the grass, they'll always be the king's wife.

source_sentence: 其母後身，作梵豫王，其女後身，作蓮華夫人。
translation: His mother's rear body was made into the king of Brahmapurohita, and his daughter's rear body became the wife of the lotus flower.

source_sentence: 由是業緣，後生賢劫千聖，以誓願力，常生賢聖。」
translation: Because of these karmic conditions, a thousand sages from the good eon will be born in the future, and by the power of their vow, they'll always become good and noble.

source_sentence: 諸比丘，聞是語已，歡喜奉行。
translation: Having heard these words, the monks were delighted and remembered them well. ****** 13. The Discourse to the Buddha ****** Thus have I heard:

translation: Zabaozang jing, vol. 1
